intro: Monocephalium batesii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, alternate leaves and produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypsela. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens in regions with a temperate climate.
